Replies.Reply: The ad depicts videotaped scenes from Wisconsin's north country-- a farmer and a cow, a woman waterskiing, a guy mowing his lawn. A flat, nasally V.O. accompanies the images.
The Brown River Valley: It's where we work. It's where we play. It's where we live. But even here in paradise, accidents can happen.

At Northlands Insurance, our goal is to provide high quality insurance services and related products to businesses and individuals in Wisconsin's Northlands. I'm Roger Lemke. Not only do I care about you, we also endeavor to give you the coverage you need at the best prices around. It's that reason Northlands has been awarded the prestigious Two Diamond Award from the American Society of Mutual Insurers three years running. Because at Northlands Insurance, we insure your dreams.
Hell, I'm just a pretty face, Bill.
Thank you. Thank you very much!
Tim! Timmy Lippe! Didn't even know you were here. You see it, bud?

Y'know what Tim, I want people to see the insurance game for what it really is-- it's a noble field. I believe that. Like I say, we're not just insuring vehicles and homes and that. Hell no. We're insuring people's dreams.
Well shit, you do, don't you? By god, I stole your line! Knew I'd heard that somewhere!
Bummer they cut your little deal outta the ad, though.
Ho-lee Christmas, knocked her outta the park, Roger! Out of the G-D park, you sonofagun!
Know how Roger used to get down there to Cedar Rapids? To the ASMI Convention? Any idea?
Flew himself. In a Cessna. Pilot.
It was all worked out. I was going to ease into retirement in July while Roger transitioned into his ownership role.
All worked out. Shit, Dione already put the down payment on a time share. Branson, Black Hills.
Yeah, whole deal. Now? Now I got my back up against Christ-knows-what.
We need those Two Diamonds more than ever, Tim. If I'm going to sell this company, we need people to feel OK about the Northlands brand.
I'd go myself but my daughter Kayla, the heavy one? She unearthed some Polack to marry her. I'm locked into that wedding over in Gladstone. No flex. Locked in.
I'm not asking you to fill Roger Lemke's shoes. Not gonna happen.
C'mon Tim. Lila's about as charismatic as a bag of hair.

You were what, 16, when I gave you that filing job? Right after your mom passed? Raising yourself pretty much, living all alone. And I'm thinking, now here's a kid. Here's a kid who's gonna go places.
Tss, maybe three'll be a charm.
Point is, I'm not exactly dancing in the streets here Tim, but it's a perception thing. You go down there to Cedar Rapids, wholesome and pie-
Aw cripes, say you'll do it.
Tim! Praise Christ you haven't left yet.

Ziegler is a cancer. Sonofabitch called one of Lemke's biggest clients-- Joyce ArmbrÃ¼ster? Smeared Roger's name and the Northlands' name. Frickin' poacher. Avoid Ziegler like the plague. The fella I got you rooming with, Ronald Wilkes-- that's who you stick by.
You got the presentation, right?
Hey-hey! That kind of prep is pure Lemke! Didn't know any better, I'd say Roger's spirit had kind of climbed into you, just planted its seed inside you there. Atta boy!

Said it before, I'll say it again: Your job, the office in Brown Valley-- all safe. What you need to worry about is getting down there and representing us the best you can. That's all you need to worry about.
Tim. Bill Krogstad. Got a call from Orin Helgesson. Tells me he's worried about you. Tells me you're palling around with Dean Ziegler.

rock the waters or whatever.

This river-- the Cedar River? It flooded the whole city a couple years ago.

People talk about the firemen and policemen and that. But think about all the claims in a disaster like that-- how hard those agents worked to make sure people's lives weren't left in the lurch. We're talking billions of dollars in damages, literally. And claim by claim, dream by dream, those agents helped rebuild this city. I'm telling you, it's a noble calling. I really believe that.
Tss. I wish.
